Package photos.Entities

Class Album

java.lang.Object
photos.Entities.Album
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Album extends Object implements Serializable
Class that is responsible for the information and behaviors associated with an album.
Author:
Prajit Kundu, Howard Luo
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Field Details

    • name

      private String name
      String that represents the given name of the album.

    • numberOfPhotos

      private int numberOfPhotos
      Integer that represents the number of photos that the album contains.

    • userInfoInstance

      public UserInfo userInfoInstance
      UserInfo object that represents the information of all users. Needed to access the information of the user that owns the album.

    • user

      public User user
      User object that represents the user that owns the album.

    • photos

      private ArrayList<Integer> photos
      Integer ArrayList that holds references to the photos that the album contains. The photos are not actually contained in each album, but rather under the user. This ArrayList stores the index in User.photoCollection of each associated photo.
      See Also:
      • User#photoCollection

    • currentPhotoIndex

      private int currentPhotoIndex
      Integer that represents the index of a specific photo in photos
      See Also:
      • getCurrentPhoto()

  • Constructor Details

    • Album

      public Album(String name)
      Constructor that creates an empty album with the specified name.
      Parameters:
      name - the desired name of the album

  • Method Details

    • addPhoto

      public void addPhoto(int photoIndex)
      This method adds a reference for a specific photo in User.photoCollection to photos. The album now "contains" the specified photo.
      Parameters:
      photoIndex - the index of the specified photo in User.photoCollection
      See Also:
      • User#photoCollection

    • deletePhoto

      public void deletePhoto(int photoIndex)
      This method removes the reference for a specific photo in User.photoCollection from photos. The album no longer "contains" the specified photo.
      Parameters:
      photoIndex - the index of the specified photo in User.photoCollection
      See Also:
      • User#photoCollection

    • photoIndex

      public int photoIndex(String photoName)
      This method returns the index in photos that is associated with a specific photo.
      Parameters:
      photoName - the name of the specified photo
      Returns:
      the index in photos for the specified photo, or -1 if it is not contained in this album

    • getPhoto

      public Photo getPhoto(String photoName)
      This method returns a Photo with the specified name, if it the album contains it.
      Parameters:
      photoName - the specified name of the photo
      Returns:
      the corresponding Photo if the album contains it, null if it does not

    • getDateRange

      public String getDateRange()
      Method that returns the date range of all the photos contained in the album. All photos in the album will have a date that falls within this range.
      Returns:
      String formatted "OldestDate - NewestDate" to represent the date range of the album

    • getCurrentPhotoIndex

      public int getCurrentPhotoIndex()
      This method gets the value of currentPhotoIndex.
      Returns:
      value of currentPhotoIndex

    • getCurrentPhoto

      public Photo getCurrentPhoto()
      This method returns the photo specified with currentPhotoIndex.
      Returns:
      the Photo that is associated with the currentPhotoIndex

    • getName

      public String getName()
      This method returns the name of the album.
      Returns:
      value of name

    • getNumberOfPhotos

      public int getNumberOfPhotos()
      This method returns the number of photos that the album contains.
      Returns:
      value of numberOfPhotos

    • getPhotos

      public ArrayList<Photo> getPhotos()
      This method returns the photos that the album contains. These photos are only copies of the original photos, so any changes performed on them are not reflected on the actual photos.
      Returns:
      ArrayList of Photos that the album contains.

    • setName

      public void setName(String name)
      This method changes the name of the album.
      Parameters:
      name - the desired name of the album

    • setCurrentPhoto

      public void setCurrentPhoto(String name)
      This method changes currentPhotoIndex to the index associated with a specific photo.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the specified photo
